intro: Hieracium tanyeces, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring moist, well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a hairy texture. Hieracium tanyeces is often found in open habitats and can form dense colonies in suitable conditions.
